column5: I just did a tour, out in front and found only 4-5 inches of ice and lots of bad slush!  So it's not good... be careful if you are traveling this end of the lake.  There are some huts out already... but I would not advise putting out huts.... there just isn't enough ice, at least not in this particular area.  I understand there may be more ice over Calander Bay area?.... but only rumours I have heard...   stay safe............  the capt.
trying to keep all the ice to yourself eh? lol jks, more people would probably notice this if you posted this in the main section
hey capt. thanks for the ice update for the awsome lake called the big nip...

With the recent cold temps, I thought there would be more ice than that. Could the currents be hindering the ice making proces.  ....and people are driving cars and trucks on L. Simcoe.  I don't get it.   Thanks for the update Capt. Hooked.
Thanks for coming out of hibernation Bud! Exactly what I told your son to tell the callers...so they leave their garbage at the other end of the lake..LOL
people are also going thorough on lake simcoe
that would be a very seious thing to happen
Just as long as it's gone by June 19th Kevin, all will be good ??
i heard that there is 10-12 inches on the east end of nipissing but people are warned to still be cautious out there.  THanks for the heads up about the west arm.  Cheers!
So what kind of fish was he trying to catch with "that" lure????   Art
ITS A FORD SO NO LOSS  LOL STUPID IS AS STUPID DOES!!!
If it was a Chevy, it would have already started to rust! jk
